[154]  In  that  sense,  the  term  “include”  would  suggest  definition  to  be
exhaustive and not extensive (Reliance Industries Ltd, Bombay v State of

column1: Maharashtra AIR 2006 Bom 213). Thus, the word “include” may, where

column2: the context so demands, be equivalent to “mean and include”, in which
